alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 23 at 5:23PM MDT until June 23 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM MDT FOR CENTRAL KIT CARSON COUNTY... At 522 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southeast of Vona, or 5 miles southwest of Stratton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...At 522 PM MDT Trained weather spotters reported 1 inch diameter hail in and around Stratton. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Vona around 530 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Stratton. This includes Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 411 and 427. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
